Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: johnmraftery
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I stayed in the new wing and my room was awesome. Hardwood floors, ceiling fan, fridge, windows that open, modern bathroom, comfortable bed. The best part was the location. It was in walking distance of everything. Minutes from the lake, fantastic restaurants, shops and nightlife. I would highly recommend this hotel. Ask to stay in the new building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice residential area with lots of restaurant choices nearby. A good alternative to big hotels downtown. Friendly staff. The room was updated, although small and had a view into the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but it's all about location”
Reviews.Author: TrevisoMA
Reviews.Content: We booked a King Suite. There was just a king size bed with nothing suite about it. All they had was a smoking room and it did smell of smoke :-(. Breakfast was a B- - but there was a Starbucks next door which made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if you avoid the noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Friday afternoon and got the room#114 which was at the end of the hall way near the gym. I went out then came back at night around 8pm then started to realize there was some kind pump noise on and off from the next room. I asked the front desk and the staff told me it was from the water heater pump. As long as someone in the building use the water, then the pump will go on. It will go off eventually if no one use the water in the building. The guy told me the hotel was fully booked so I could not switch the room at that night. At around 1am, I could not sleep at all because the noise was still on and off intermittently. I complained to the front desk again, a different staff checked the computer then switched the room for me. It was strange I could not switch the room earlier. More strangely, the hotel staffs well understood the noise problem when I complained. They still rent the room and expect some customers might not complain so they can rip off those customers. The new room was quite and nice. The free WiFI and breakfast were also good. I would give the hotel a 5 stars if I didn't get in the first room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Lakeview”
Reviews.Author: danielprague
Reviews.Content: If you dont wish to stay in downtown Chicago, and Lakeview is your favorite part of town, you cant go wrong with this place... very clean, comfy, little breakfast and great location.. so dont be discouraged by the best western sign, its way better !

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to pick a Chicago Hotel when you don't know the area”
Reviews.Author: JHarmon5764
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible time picking a Chicago area hotel since there are so many boutique ones when I was to be traveling with my two teenagers for a concert. I initially picked this one because of the Best Western name, but it was not what I would say is a typical Best Western it was better. The parking which I had read was challenging was very easy and the people were still friendly even though we moved our chair several times in the short time we were there. When we saw the hotel from the outside we were a little nervous, but the rooms were VERY nice. Spacious, clean and safe. Traveling alone with two teenage girls I was impressed when we came in that one of the front desk folks who didn't recognize us actually stopped us to be sure we were guests. I would recommend for any type of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Gem in Lincoln Park Area”
Reviews.Author: BorisMD
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this place says "Best Western", and that's a good thing. The hotel is not chain-like, but has more of a historic B&B feel to it. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and pointed us in the direction of some excellent restaurants within walking distance. In my previous visits to Chicago, I always opted for a big hotel near Michigan Avenue. I'm glad we switched. The Junior suite room has 2 full size beds, and a living area with sofa, chair, and desk adjacent to the sleeping area. The decor is urban modern, and the bathroom mirror gives the wildest highlight reflections to your pupils. The continental breakfast was nothing special, but the price was right. So, stay downtown for more money and a low-ceilinged, small room with no character? Or stay a few minutes North in a charming neighborhood in a spacious suite with free breakfast? I know how I'll decide next time I'm in Chi-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and cozy”
Reviews.Author: hockeydudette
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel with great rooms and a great location at a very reasonable rate. I would recommend it for the business or casual traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kurtedjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on Sunday, 1/8/2012. The location, on Broadway, is very convenient for those who wish to stay in the North Lake Shore area of Chicago. There is very convenient parking next door for about $20 per day and you can come and go as you please. The check-in was pleasant and quick. The staff were very friendly and professional. Our room was very nice for about $100 ($135 including parking and taxes). In room amenities were great - big flat-screen TV, Wi-Fi, bath, frig., Keurig coffee maker. Continental breakfast was good. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the area. We will definitely stay there on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Location was key to my trip.”
Reviews.Author: cmstudebaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed to be a little pricey for not being in downtown Chicago, but it was centrally located for where we needed to be, so we were willing to pay the higher price. The walls were fairly thin and we could hear people talking when they were in the hallway. The rooms were pretty standard. Parking was right next door, but cost an extra $22 a day, which was added to your room upon checkout. The bed didn't have very warm blankets, but when we turned the heat up in the room, it was comfortable. Our friend who was staying in another room first got a room with no heat, but was quickly moved to another room. Check-in and check-out was quick. The staff was friendly and helpful. I usually end up staying with friends when I visit the area, but this hotel served its purpose for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Becky D
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was close to my son's apartment. We were able to walk everywhere in the neighborhood. It was a lovely hotel. The employees were very kind and helpful. The room was wonderful, beds comfy, quiet halls. I would definitely recommend it and will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location and great service!Walk to restaurants and convenience stores and feel as you were in your own neighb”
Reviews.Author: evillegas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after searching something close to downtown but everything was busy or extremely expensive! After all, i found a great experience, the location, a bit far from my business destination (15min taxi to the McCormic Place and 10min from dwntown) but the hotel has everything: free internet, spacious rooms, good TV and programming, etc... The best part is the service attitude from the personnel, they gave me some advises on how to maximize my visit, where to go around, how to leverage offers and deals for saving money, etc... And taking caee of my luggage until very late! The bad: they cleaned my room late but they done quicly and silently. So if you want to enjoy Chicago as local people do, this is a great option... Very close to the Cubs stadium, theaters, 1 block from the bus stop and the lake. Actually this is the Lake View area (or also called Wrigley Viile). I will come here next time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good motel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: paularea
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable room with free internet access. Decent breakfast if eating area a little small. Short walk from CTA Addison stop and plenty of good eating spots in the vicinity

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: gemsstock
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Chicago and I booked this place based on recommendations. I was very happy with the King Suite, the room was spacious and very clean, the bathroom was huge with a very nice shower. Complimentary bottles of water and breakfast were also appreciated. The area is pleasant with lots of nice cafes, diners, clubs and restaurants. Once I got the hang with the Lakeshore Drive Express buses, the commute to downtown was also pretty fast, though in hindsight, I should have booked a hotel in Near North or the Loop which would have been more convenient for sight seeing, though this is probably only true for first time visitors to Chicago. For people who like a relaxed stay at a good price and don't mind the trip to downtown, this is a very good solution.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Boystown vacation”
Reviews.Author: Xorax
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, with mostly gay managers. It's one (long) block from the heart of the Boystown bars/clubs/restaurants and there are plenty of GLBT friendly restaurants and bars on the same block. The continental breakfast is limited compared to most Best Westerns, but the WiFi connection was good in both our rooms, and overall our rooms were clean, quiet and spacious. I'll probably only stay here on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ldruken
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite ( it was all that was left). It was a bit pricey but you can't beat the location. Great restaurants all around and 5 minute walk to the Boystown clubs. Great location and great restaurants in the area. I liked the laid back feel to the area and this is the best hotel in the area. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LarryGentry
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Boystown/Lakeview, everything you could want is within walking distance. Walk out the front door and walk down Hawthorne Place one block and you can hop on a bus to downtown Chicago on North Lakeshore Drive. Parking is expensive so I just took a cab to and from the airport. Next time I will look into the light rail. I left a day early and they charged a $50 cancellation fee so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Techie3
Reviews.Content: The Good: I had a two day stay at this hotel during a conference on the conference rate. It is a nice facility with a generous size room. No pool but a sauna and good hot tub and workout area with top line machines but limited selection. The breakfast "buffet" was adequate and between a real buffet and a continental breakfast. The lobby coffee was good. The staff was generally friendly and average but certainly not outgoing or overly accommodating. The Bad: The rooms have Keurig K-cup coffee makers. My experience with these is good but the coffee here was terrible. It had to be a really cheap coffee. There were 3 kinds, all "Green Mountain" brand: breakfast, mocha and decaf. both the caffinated ones were wretched. Stick with the lobby coffee, available 24/7. The rooms are nice but certainly not worth the upscale cost. Yes, it's a Lakeview neighborhood facility but not special in any way. Add the $22.00+tax parking and it makes for an expensive weekend. The conference rate was certainly no bargain over the regular rates in my opinion. The had a disagreement on the rate and the desk staff was unsympathetic or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler2151
Reviews.Content: My Brothers and I went to catch a Reds / Cubs game at Wrigley and we stayed here. The rooms were great, the location was perfect, and the staff was friendly and helpful. We will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Third time not a charm”
Reviews.Author: throne5448
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 times before. This time we stayed in a queen room. Previously stayed in larger rooms. In this room air conditioner was next to your head. Very noisy. Bathroom much smaller than other rooms. Bedspread has blanket inside it, so you are suppose to use your bedspread as your blanket. DISGUSTING !! The first thing I do in a room is take the bedspread off the bed. We asked the desk clerk to request house keeping cover a blanket with a sheet to be used instead. He said he would note it to be done. At noon we checked with the desk clerk then on duty, she never saw it, but would take care of it. When we got back to our room it was not done and had to ask for a third time. The hotel is the only one in the area of Wrigley Field. When there is a game or event taking place there the rooms get very expensive. I would stay downtown at a better hotel for less, but this one is the only one within walking distance of our sons apt. I'm sure the hotel manager has no personality because none of his desk people have much personality. Will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Room and bath were great but check to see if baseball fans will be in town”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTXTraveler60
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed our spacious room and bath (two double beds plus a living area) within walking distance to many restaurants, shopping and the Lincoln Park area, but there were rowdy (drunk) young adult males in town for a baseball game who unfortunately were also staying at the hotel-evidently about 10 in a room. The complimentary breakfast could use some healthier menu items. Rates seem somewhat high for the quality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “A Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: Fiesta1025
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for those wanting to stay close to Wrigley Field. I was in Chicago for the Paul McCartney concert and wanted a hotel within walking distance to Wrigley. This hotel is a change of pace from Magnificent Mile properties. The Broadway area is very walkable, diverse, and eclectic. Plenty of shopping and dining. I liked Ann Sather for breakfast and Stella's Diner. This hotel is not your usual Best Western. It has a small courtyard, boutique feel, with continental breakfast, microwave, and refrigerator. The staff was very helpful. Downtown is only a cab away and the staff will find one. I will stay here again if I want to be near Wrigley. Plenty of Starbucks handy,too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: griffintino
Reviews.Content: We wanted a Hotel close to Wrigley Field to see a Chicago Cubs game because my Dad is 85 years old. This was the perfect spot. The room was clean, the service was great and the people were fantastic. Great restaurants in the area along with a supermarket if you want snacks for your room. A short cab ride will take you anywhere you want to go. Ask the front desk to put the light on out front and a taxi will be there in a minute. I would recommend for anyone. Look for Internet deals. They definitely had some.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Biz1973
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a recent trip to Chicago because my boyfriend had stayed here on a previous trip, and because of it's proximity to Wrigleyville. Worked our perfectly! Easy walking distance to Wrigley, and a quick and inexpensive cab ride to other areas in the city. Rooms were on the smaller side, but adequate, and nicely furnished with a microwave, fridge, and Keurig machine in each room (what a pleasant surprise the Keurig was, compared to normally bad hotel coffee!). Somehow we ended up in the ONLY room in the entire hotel without a safe (at least that's what they told us), so if you need a safe, don't stay in room 401. When I called the front desk to inquire, they did offer to move us, but we were already unpacked and it wasn't that big of a deal. They a also offered to keep some things for us in the hotel safe, but that wasn't convenient. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and although overlooking N. Broadway Avenue, very quiet. We didn't use the wireless, so can't comment there, but the computer in the lobby & it's attached printer was very convenient when it came time to check in for our flights home. The included breakfast was pretty basic, basically an enhanced continental breakfast with hard boiled eggs and sausage gravy. We only took advantage of it one day. Not a lot of space to sit for breakfast if it's raining outside (it was the day we did), as most of their seating is in the courtyard (nice courtyard by the way), but there was a small table and two chairs in our rooms which made for a nice breakfast spot. Although, if I were you I'd head across the street to Ann Sather's for cinnamon rolls! We didn't park a car, but our friends did and parking seemed to be fairly easy and convenient, although the garage is next door. Overall, this was a great choice for us for our recent trip to Chicago! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: beehostess
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at this neighborhood gem of a hotel. As others have said the location is great, a few blocks from Lake Michigan, Wrigley Field and plenty of nightlife. The room was very clean and well appointed, including a fridge, microwave and Kuerig coffee maker. Overall I thought this was a great hotel and would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: marctravis
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for Pride and for his graduation. We loved our stay. The staff was very friendly and the neighborhood was great. The room was clean and the maids kept it that way. Special thanks to Kwame for his great directions to the Sears tower and to O'Hare on the train. One thing I would have done differently: We should have taken the Metra to the hotel. If you take the Blue line downtown and transfer to Red at Jackson, you can get off at Addison. After you exit to the street, just walk to Broadway, take a right and go a couple blocks. We could have saved $50 in cab fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lisastl70
Reviews.Content: Great Location for those who do not want to stay downtown,but still be close. Rates are a little high for what they offer(no pool,cheap continental breakfast). The neighbor hood is great very hip and layed back easy walk to just about anything you need,short EL ride downtown. The one thing I was not pleased with was the Hotel staff,unfriendly and not very helpful but was able to over look this minor flaw. Be aware if you go for the parking keep in mind you have to leave your car key with the lot attendence.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Trainmodeller
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in good Chicago location on north side. Easy access to transit with Broadway bus immediately outside, Addison and Belmont buses a block away and Red Line subway within 1/2 mile walk. Hotel was set back from the road and very quiet at night. Good sized rooms were updated and very comfortable. Would definitely use again for a weekend stay. Continental breakfast buffet had limited choice and set up was in a cramped location. Not up to snuff with competitors. However, just 50 yards across the street is an Ann Sathers Restaurant that specializes in breakfasts and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MommyToFour
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Best Western and I was pleasantly surprised. Welcoming staff, clean, and great price for a Chicago Hotel. Also, good restaurants within walking distance. I will be visiting this Best Western often on business and look forward to accumulating Best Western points :)

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyePhotos
Reviews.Content: Having previously lived in Lakeview, I was very familiar with the location of this hotel and it always looked great from the outside. I try and get back every couple of years around my birthday to see friends and enjoy some time in Boystown. This time we decided to get a room in the city since my friend I was staying with lives in the suburbs. Got a good rate online for Saturday and Sunday nights. We checked in around 7ish I think it was. I forget now the name of the person that checked us in, but it was a very pleasant experience. I went ahead and played the birthday card and we were giving a nice upgrade to one of the junior suites. Room was gorgeous. We really didn't need the kitchenette, but it was well laid out. We were on the 4th floor of the annex building looking out over Broadway. Having lived in the city before, the noise never bothers me. The hardwood floor in the main area and the tile in the bathroom really gave it a great touch. And the shower. Wow, just wow. Love the rainfall shower head. And the rich dark colors of the wall tile really worked well. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. Being as we were out late and sleeping in, we didn't partake of housekeeping during the stay, but we had a moment to chat with the lady, and she did seem quite nice. Really just did not want to leave the room. As my friend commented, one could practically live in it, as it was about as large as the average studio apartment in Chicagoland. Departure day was very smooth. We over slept a little and when I called and asked for a late checkout 1hr past normal time, it was granted very cheerfully with no hesitation. Working in the hospitality industry myself, I always tend to be very judgmental when I stay somewhere. This hotel met, and in some cases exceeded my expectations. The only negative from this stay wasn't the hotel's fault. My friend parked his car at the garage next door, and some kind of dirty water or something was allowed to drip onto it. It was very nasty looking, but thankfully didn't appear to be caustic.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons in Lakeview!”
Reviews.Author: Pennden
Reviews.Content: Such a perfect spot for visiting friends and misbehaving in Boystown. My 2nd stay in 5 years and still impressive: big rooms and new baths this time around. Friendly staff, and within comfortable walking distance of bus, el, restaurants, etc. If you need to stumble home after a great night out why stay anywhere else?!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Alley”
Reviews.Author: MarisaO
Reviews.Content: The place was great - clean rooms and excellent location. I am a light sleeper, though, and we had two major problems. Large garbage cans were dragged down the alley on both Monday and Friday morning at 6.30am that were VERY loud and the people dragging them were equally loud. In addition, there was a loud clicking noise in the alley facing south that did not allow us to sleep very well. it went on and off all night. If you are a light sleeper, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant travel surprise in quite a few years”
Reviews.Author: DFWcoltDad
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot (all 7 continents and 73 countries in the last 10 years) and generally prefer to stay in deluxe hotels, Four Seasons, Mandarins, Ritz-Carltons, and the like. For personal reasons, this trip we needed to stay in the Lakeview area of Chicago. There aren't many hotels in that part of town to choose from and, more or less blindly, we selected the Hawthorne Terrace. From the moment we arrived we were impressed. The welcome from the front desk was friendly and efficient. The room, while on the small side, was way more than adequate. The bed and the linens were amazing for a hotel in this price range. The bathroom was totally new, with good water pressure, terrific lighting and plenty of counter space. Two bottles of water were provided each night, complentary, and the internet was complimentary too. It wasn't opulent luxury like a Four Seasons, but the bed, the bottled water (for which Four Seasons charges $5-8), the internet service (for which we've paid $12-15 per night),and the bathroom amenities made us wonder why we stay at Four Seasons properties for 4 times more (at least). We checked out to drive up to Wisconsin for a family reunion. Two days later, as we were planning to fly out of O'Hare to go home, all flights were cancelled due to a pending blizzard. Rather than stay at the airport, we chose to go back to the Hawthorne Terrace. They remembered us, felt sorry for us in our plight, and gave us the same rate we had had over the weekend and upgraded us to a lovely suite, complete with kitchen, dual sink vanity in the bathroom, and a spacious walk-in shower. We had another great bed with quality linens and toughed out the storm. Two days later we were able to fly out and, as much as we were anxious to return home, we were actually sorry to be leaving such a terrific find. The location was great, with plenty of restaurants, clubs, and fun shops within walking distance. I would give this place an A+ in just about every aspect. I honestly don't know how they can provide such a tremendous product for such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay that was very nice”
Reviews.Author: getupdosomething
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel for almost a month and a half due to my condo being severly damaged from a neighbors broken water pipe. I stayed in two different rooms, one the junior suite and the other a two bed full suite in what they call their annex--two king beds, living room, huge shower, free internet, hardwood floors, full kitchen, etc. I was very pleased with the accomodations in an excellent location! There isn't room service but with the many restaurants in the neighboorhood it wasn't needed--they also serve a free continental breakfast each morning. I would definatley stay here again if needed or recommend others.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Small Hotel at the Doorstep of Wrigleyville, Shopping, Dining, and Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: We were in town for New Years. I last stayed here more than 6 years ago and was surprised by the changes. While the bricked outdoor terrace and small lobby seemed to be almost the same as I remembered from our last stay, the rooms had obviously been renovated. Our room was on the 3th floor near the elevators but hardly ever heard any noise. Gone were the old fashion looking wallpaper, beige everywhere, with cheap looking curtains, fake pressboard furniture, the typical polyester comforters and circa-1990s TV. Instead, the room was in warm browns, the curtain was replaced by plantation shutters, there was a 42in flat panel LCD, nice wood furniture with actual headboard, and nice plush bedding with duvet. The room also had a small refrigerator with separate freezer, two complementary daily bottles of water, as well as a microwave and a Kurig single-serving coffee maker with various flavors. The bath was also renovated with matching tiled floor and tub/shower surround, rainshower, and even a nice, large back-lit mirror. I wish I had taken pictures of the hotel to upload so you could see all the improvements! I didn't get a chance to see what the continental breakfast looked like, nor the fitness room with jacuzzi, but we were busy having fun taking in the neighborhood with unique shops, a variety of restaurants, and the nightlife of "Boystown." Not to say that everything was all great. It's still a small hotel with limited in-house amenities. They couldn't see my reservation because it was not booked on the Best Western website (just showed the front desk person the e-mail confirmation on my phone and it was all good), and the tub drained pretty slow, but what can I expect from a building that's probably 100yrs old. The room rate was somewhat more than the below $100/nt deals I could have gotten for similar or even nicer hotels in the Loop or Michigan Ave, but the location was ideal for our purposes of nightlife and restaurants as we walked to everything and probably saved a small fortune on cabs. This is Chicago after all, and parking is scarce and once you park, you almost never want to move your car. Fortunately, parking was only $22/nt (it was valet parking in the garage was next to hotel with in-and-out privileges) compared to $40+ at downtown hotels. There are two red-line train stations, each a 5-10min walk if you want to brave the winter weather, which we did. There are many good restaurants in the area. Don't miss Ann Sathers across the street for a good breakfast place. Down the street is Joy's Noodle and Rice Restaurant for Thai. PingPong was also down the street--very popular contemporary Asian restaurant populated by the mostly younger and trendy crowd, waits for a table even during the week may be long without reservations, and somewhat loud with the blaring music. There are a host of other restaurants (Continental, Mexican, Diner, Contemporary American, etc) along Broadway and several blocks west on Halsted.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our needs”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandOhioMary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met up with my sister and her husband for a weekend visit with our kids who live in Chicago. We were looking for a place close to their apartments, and this was really our best option location wise. We were within walking distance to the Belmont train station, very convenient. We stayed in a suite that was spotless and spacious and reasonably priced for two couples to split. There was a pull out bed, a bedroom alcove, and a master bedroom, as well as an efficiency kitchen. Both mornings there was your typical hotel breakfast set out, but we crossed the street for Ann Sathers awesome breakfast! Staff was helpful, felt safe, a nice place to stay. This will be our hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Waiting For”
Reviews.Author: flacucha612
Reviews.Content: With our daughter living in Chicago in the Lake View area, we have tried on several occasions to book this hotel but it was always full. Now we know why. Our room was clean and spacious with lovely touches like a small frig, micro, coffeemaker, excellent beds, piles of pillows, two flat screen TVs. Well stocked complimentary breakfast and coffee and tea always available. The staff was friendly and helpful. My only comment would be that we had to wait an hour and a half past check in time for the room to be ready. We hope to be able to stay here again on our next trip, but have been advised to try to book 3 to 4 months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend getaway to Wrigley Field”
Reviews.Author: dave2step
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights this past weekend, as we were in town for the DMB concerts at Wrigley Field. The location is very convenient to Wrigley Field, with it being about a 15 to 20 minute walk at a reasonable pace. We felt very safe walking around the neighborhood both day and night. Other than Wrigley Field, there's really nothing else "touristy" to do in this area, however the "L" stop at Addison is a convenient way to get downtown. The room was fairly comfortable, and I felt it was decent value for what we paid. My only negatives would be 1) the air conditioner, and 2) the maid service. After playing around with the air conditioner for a while, we determined that when set at 70 degrees, the air conditioner would pump such cold air into the room that you could store meat for long periods of time without concern. For a hotel stay however, it was way too cold. The unfortunate thing was that once you turned it up just one degree to 71, the air temperature quickly made us feel as though we were in the southern Caribbean. There was no comfortable temperature, it was either extremely hot, or extremely cold. We finally just unplugged it. Our second complaint was the maid service. We left the room at 8:30am and placed one of those "make up the room please" signs on the door. When we returned at 4:30pm, we were disappointed that they did not make it to our room yet. Finally at around 5:15pm the maid made it to our room, at which point we told her not to bother. Definite room for improvement in that area. Other than that however, it really isn't a bad little hotel. I'd definitely stay there again if I ever needed to be in the Wrigleyville area again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: This is a small, quaint, comfy little hotel which serves a very diverse community. This is not a Streeterville or Loop kind of hotel but a very personal, friendly and accommodating Lakeview hotel. The staff will go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. There are many places to get a bite to eat within a block from the front door. The rooms are clean and well appointed with a french country feel. Free WiFi, flat panel television, fridge, microwave, continental breakfast and a great little patio to have your cup of coffee in the morning and people watch. The junior suites are very roomy with a DVD player and jacuzzi tub. C lubing, Wrigley Field and the Red Line are all in walking distance making this little hotel a great retreat and a comfortable stay. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Good digs near Wrigley”
Reviews.Author: GolfingGod
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and modern and comfortable. They have a nice free gym and jacuzzi, and free internet and breakfast. Easy access to transit; walk to Wrigley field. Two complaints: 1. the air conditioner was very loud. When I complained, they asked me to call during the day when the maintenance guy was in, but of course I was out and about during the day so it never got addressed. 2. One of the desk clerks was very unfriendly (others were OK)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelstin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away off a busy neighborhood street.The room- a junior suite was perfect. The front desk could have been more helpful wih bus schedules. 15 min walk to Wrigley Field. Parking garage next door was satisfactory. Breakfast selection was very small but eating outside on the terrace was really special. We were surprised that you had to request maid service and that it wasn't automatic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, again and again!”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: This is the third consecutive year we've stayed at the Hawthorne Terrace over Pride weekend, and not the first time I have reviewed this property on tripadvisor.com. The hotel occupies a perfect location in Chicago's famed Boystown district for viewing the parade, shopping, eating, nightlife and more. It's also very convenient to Wrigley Field for a Cubs game, or Chicago's beautiful white sand beaches. The rooms received an upgrade from last year, no more kitschy country Victorian decor. The rooms are now simple, modern earth tones with dark wood furniture. A very nice change! It also seems to be a nice place to work, as year after year we see many of the same employees faces. And, year after year, many of the same guests come back for pride, pointing to the popularity of this well run establishment. The property also accepts pets (with a deposit), which is nice, because we like to bring both of our dogs into the city for the weekend. They get lots of attention from the staff (particularly from Jackie in housekeeping and Allen at the front desk, as well as other guests. We've only had one 'hiccup' in the last three years and that was our final bill this time around. It was far more than what I was originally quoted, and had received a confirmation for. I brought this to the attention of the front desk, who then spoke with management, and my bill was quickly corrected. Kudos to an honest operation! Do yourself a favor, next time you're in the area and need a place to stay, check in to the Hawthorne Terrace. We'll be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “I got upgraded to one of the hotel's new...”
Reviews.Author: dmhinsf
Reviews.Content: I got upgraded to one of the hotel's new suites. The room was spacious, clean, shiny, new and very well appointed. The location is perfect - very close to bars, restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: TheHamptonsLover
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the hotel for two nights during Memorial Day weekend, a suite in the annex addition was superb - as was everything about the stay. The amount of space, layout, high quality materials, and ambience were great, and you cannot beat the location. Service was consistently upbeat and helpful - kudos especially to Ken. Garage parking next door worked out quite fine; garage staff was quite cordial as well. Hawthorne Terrace is truly a gem of an oasis in the middle of hustle-bustle Lakeview area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great neighborhood, bad room”
Reviews.Author: beverlyrd
Reviews.Content: We booked a nonsmoking room with 2 queen beds and ended up in a smoking room with double beds. There had been a problem with the reservation (not our fault), and the hotel was sold out so we had to take that room. The room would have been lovely except that the bed was too small and the room stunk from smoke. In fact, the entire hallway stunk despite the hotel posting a sign that it was a nonsmoking facility. There were even ashtrays in the room. Also, children were in the room above jumping on beds very early in the morning. Staff did not make any effort to compensate us for the problems after we spent 3 nights there. Other than that, it's in a great location, breakfast was fine, and it could be a wonderful place to stay whenever in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great North Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Hawthorne Terrace primarily because of its location in Boystown. I had stayed here in2005 and thought it was dowdy. However, it has been renovated and it's now absolutely perfect. Clearly, it's not a luxury hotel like the Peninsula, but I wanted a nice hotel on the north side near all the restaurants, bars, shops and friends I like to visit inChicago. This fit the bill. the (recent) renovation made all the rooms very attactive. i slept like a baby in the beds, and the staff was helpful, friendly, and prompt. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a nice hotel that's not in the hubbub of the North Michigan Avenue/ Mag mile craziness.

Reviews.Title: “It stank.”
Reviews.Author: kimciara
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel two weeks ago whilst visiting Chicago. Upon arriving at night, the hotel looked pretty from the outside with lots of fairy lights in the little courtyard in the front. Check in was easy and we were told our room was on the second floor. Upon exiting the elevator on the econd floor we were struck by an almost overwhelming smell. I can only describe it as dust, stale cigarette smoke and damp. It made the air heavy and I actually found it difficult to breathe. Inside our room, we couldn't smell it so much but every time we went into the hallway, we found ourselves almost running to the elevator. I informed the front desk. The lady told us that we were on a floor that used to be a smoking floor and they were currently working on "making the place fresher". She told us that they were fully booked so there was no other room to put us in. We put up with the smell but I wouldn't go back there. By the way, I'm a smoker and the smell was far too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cwfjmf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king bed suite. It is in a building annex accesible with a room key. Our room was room 428, top floor, corner, view of the Hawthorne Terrace. Parking was in a deck right next door to the hotel with in and out priviledges. The rooms have recently been remodeled. The bathroom, while small (no tub) was beautiful and tastefully done, great water pressure. It's more of an efficiency apartment than a room. I king bed in a room with a door, another "room" through an arching doorway that also had a king bed, as well as a sofa (sofabed)/living room and a dining table with four chairs. There was a microwave and small fridge and small counter space as well. Hardwood floors, 52 inch flat screen tv's= three in total. Considering you're on a busy street in the Lakeview neighborhood of Chicago, very little street noise (occasional siren). If you looked out the window and down the street you could see Lake Michigan at the end of the block. We stay here because it's close to my daughter's apartment. Love the neighborhood, right next to a great grocery store, as well as lots of restaurants of all sorts and pubs. Great location, within walking distance of the Belmont train station too. The hotel has an ample continental breakfast as well- cinammon buns, bagels, toast, cereal, biscuits and gravy, yogurt. Great hotel, will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: cujo16969
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing! It is wonderfully priced for the location. My friend and I really wanted to stay in boystown, and this was definitely a good choice. The rooms were clean, with the exception of a little new construction dust. Very good view, flat screen TV, cable, free internet (and we all know how difficult it is to get free internet in hotels nowadays), great coffee, very cozy rooms. The breakfast in the morning isn't plentiful, but very good for a quickie... Lol! The hotel staff was very friendly as well. Parking is a public parking garage, and they keep your keys, so I was iffy about that, but all in all it was a great stay! I WILL come back and stay here when I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: serdarsoydemir
Reviews.Content: Best Western was very good in overall facilities, rooms were very new and employers were kind. Hotel is near to Michigan Street for shopping and entertainment. Only missing thing may be mentioned was breakfast, which should be richer.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of quiet in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: Rebble
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a colleague in Sept. 2008. Having never been to Chicago before it came as a pleasant surprise. It was more like a country hotel back home the frontage is very attractive with creepers and small courtyard garden in the front. The location is very convenient for bars and restaurants in the locality and there is a busy nightlife however we never felt intimidated. All the locals are very relaxed and happy to talk. There are also convenient bus routes in to the centre of Chicago. As to the rooms these are quiet, very clean and very comfortable. The room I had, had air con an immaculate bathroom, TV, phone and drink making facillities. There is no restaurant but the staff were very helpful in providing suggestions for places to eat. Breakfast is a basic serve yourself affair with toast, cereal, coffee, mufins etc. so familys or tourists looking for a cheap breakfast fill up might find this a little limiting. On the whole it was a really enjoyable stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GlynnisL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hawthorne Terrace twice...eight years apart. The first tine I stayed there (quite by happenstance) was in 2000. I could never forget how at home I felt in that little hotel, and how great the staff were. Eight years later when a friend suggested returning to Chicago, I jumped at the chance to stay at this hotel again. It was every bit as wonderful as I'd remembered. The rooms are cozy and clean. The hotel boasts a lovely - you guessed it - terrace, not to mention a fabulous hot tub and sauna. The staff are personable and helpful. The location is also prime. It is in "Boystown," which translates into great restaurants and shops, an active nightlife and attractive, trendy homes. It is approximately 3 blocks from the beach (Lake Michigan) and very close to Wrigley Field. The price is also reasonable and it is part of the Best Western chain (not that you'd ever know it was part of a chain) so there are frequently room deals. I love it! I'd move in if I could!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: Marisol2
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room, but were upgraded to a suite in their new building next door to the main hotel--very nice! Like an upscale studio apartment in a lovingly restored vintage building. Stylish and immaculate bathroom and kitchenette, hardwood floors, comfy couch and new bigscreen TV. Loved it. Staff were so nice. And cinnamon rolls from Ann Sather for breakfast--yum!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of the Marathon weekend so the only reason I would not give this a 10/10 was the price was pretty inflated...but so was every hotel in the city and surrounds of Chicago. We stayed in a King Suite for two nights and wow, what a beautiful room we had. Large living area, separate kitchen and very big bathroom with double sinks. The shower was a highlight, it had a rain-shower head. Large flat screen TV, very modern decor with clean lines. It had character too; older hard wood floors and curved entry-ways into the bedroom. Great bed. I honestly was not expecting such a beautiful room being a Best Western brand, but we were very impressed. The gardens and outside of the hotel are so charming too. Great area of Chicago, ideal for Cubs fans or for visitors visiting friends and family who live north of the city. Would most definitely recommend to friends and stay again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Wrigleyville/Boystown”
Reviews.Author: runchadrun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hawthorne Terrace on a visit to Chicago to see some baseball and be a tourist. The location is excellent. The hotel is located about a 10-15 minute walk from Wrigley Field and is probably the closest hotel. It is located in the gay district of Chicago, though the gay bars are mostly on Halstead Street a short walk away. The Addision Street Red Line station is located next to Wrigley Field so it's reasonably close to public transportation. From O'Hare, I took the Blue Line and transferred to the 152 Addision bus, got off on Broadway, and walked a couple of blocks to the hotel. If you do drive be aware that it's $22/day to park in the lot next door. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and a Treasure Island gourmet grocery store next door and a Jewel-Osco a block away. Vegetarians should check out the Chicago Diner on Halstead and Roscoe. When I arrived their computers were down and it took about 20 minutes before I could check in but it was fast once things came back up. If you arrive at the hotel after 11:00 pm you have to use the phone in the vestibule to call the front desk staffer, who can see you through the door, or show your key for them to let you in. My room was a queen way at the back of the hotel (literally; my window looked into the courtyard of the apartment building behind the hotel) on the 4th floor. It was a small room but perfect for one person. The bathroom was big and bright and the bed had 5 pillows. There's a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in the room and a safe that will fit a standard size laptop. My only complaint about the room setup is that it's not possible to watch TV from the bed because of where it's positioned. This may be unique to the queen rooms, though. One piece of advice: I've never seen a hotel with slower housekeeping staff. I went to a Cubs game and got back at 4:00 pm and my room still wasn't made up. They were working on the room across the hall so I just gave them my trash since I didn't really need fresh towels after one night. On future mornings I put the "housekeeping please" sign on the doorknob and it was done before I came back. I did hear them working on rooms as late as 5:00 pm which seems rather slow when there were only 17 rooms on the floor. The continental breakfast is another weakness. It was instant oatmeal, pastries, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. I've stayed at many Best Westerns and other mid-price chains and this was probably the least substantial breakfast I've ever seen. There is also no dedicated breakfast room...you can eat in the lobby, on the patio, or back in your room. Despite these minor complaints, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: arabhammerhead
Reviews.Content: The strongest point about this hotel is its location. It shares Broadway with many restaurants and cafes. Nearby Clark Street has a bustling nightlife with many clubs and bars. Wriggly Field is nearby for the baseball fan. Holstead had a special market day when I was there. That said, it has all the complimentary items such as wi-fi, breakfast, and water by the bed. All this and cheaper than hotels in downtown so I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the gay traveler”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: This location is PERFECT for the gay traveller. I am in chicago a lot for fun and work. When I go for fun or if I decide to spend the weekend after being there for work I always tray to stay there. It is only a few blocks from the red line Addison stop and right beside a grocery store and the bars are only about a 2 minute walk. The hottub is very nice and very powerful. The staff, especially Mike and Dan, are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are decent size and all have safes, fridges and microwaves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Nice Hotel. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated in "boystown," for those looking for LGBT nightlife. It's listed as a boutique hotel--not quite sure how accurate that is, but it is a very nice place. The staff were great--very helpful and friendly. Thumbs up all around.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: latinboy1976
Reviews.Content: Ok I want to end this review off on a good note so I am going to list what I did not like. The decor of the room. The room had that nasty green BW carpet, the wall paper looked like something from the waiting area of an Old Country Buffet, the internet (wireless) was very spotty and dropped quite a few times, the safe did not fit my laptop, the contraption that help the tv was in faced west and the bed was facing north south so one could not lay in bed and watch tv. That is all the negative that I have to say about the hotel. I was located in room 215. This is on the second floor all the way down the hall going east. The room was quite roomy for two people and if I do say so bigger then what I am used to for hotel rooms that I've had lately. Not a complaint just an observation. I found the staff to be casual and very nice. I didn't feel I couldn't ask them for directions and what not if needed. To the north there is a Treasure Island (a Euro grocery store which kicks azz!), there is also a 24 hr Jewell grocery store. Go to the south a few blocks and there is a Walgreens. Location wise at least for me this is a great place! My favorite coffee place Intelligentsia is only a few blocks, the red line for the EL is also a short walk to either the Addison or Belmont stop. I got a really great rate on this hotel about 92 usd a night. Rates for this hotel being so close to Wrigley can go up to 200 usd a night so do your research and don't be afraid to ask for a sighs lower rate. That is what I did and got 10% knocked off that. Oh SNAP! I almost forgot the best thing about this hotel. THE PILLOWS!!!!! OMG!!!!! I rarely if ever go right to sleep when my head hits the pillow. I am usually still laying there 30 or so mins later but not staying here. I was out in prob 5-10 mins at the most. I plan on hoping on shopbestwestern.com and getting me some of those magical pillows. They are better then the 4 or 5 star hotels I've stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “No Umbrellas!”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: The other reviews here are all correct - this is a nicely located hotel with overall friendly staff. Decor is ok. Check-in and check-out were both quick and easy. The included breakfast buffet is really weak, but Ann Sathers across the street is amazing so no need to eat at the hotel anyway. We stayed three days/nights, including the single rainiest day in Chicago's history. I took it for granted that a hotel that bills itself as an "elegant boutique hotel" would have umbrellas for guests to use. Our bill averaged over $300/night with taxes - for that money I would definitely expect some umbrellas sitting near the main door or in the room. Nope. Not a single one. I had to run down the street in the pouring rain with my 11-month-old to get a cheap one at a local store. And here is my other hotel-related rain complaint. The ramp that comes into the hotel is fully visible to the front desk staff. It's curvy and takes a little while to navigate with a stroller or the luggage cart. There were numerous times when I was trying to navigate a stroller with one hand while carrying an umbrella with the other hand. Approaching the lobby door, the 2-3 otherwise unoccupied people at the front desk would be watching this. Never once did one of them come around to help with the door. It wasn't just me - they never helped with the door with anyone else either - old people, people loaded down with luggage, etc.... NOT what I would expect for $300+ a night. So would I stay here again? Maybe, based on location. Definitely not, based on overall service for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanGiz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hawthorne Best Western from Aug. 3-6. The hotel is lovely and in an ideal location. We had a short walk to Wriggley Field as well as to many good restaurants. The hotel is also situated near the Red Line train which we used to attend a White Sox game.(direct- no need to transfer). We were at the Hawthorne during the storm/tornado on Aug. 4th. The hotel was without power for about 17 hours. The staff remained calm and tried to make us as comfortable as possible. The front desk personnel were very friendly and willing to help us plan excursions around the city. I would highly recommend staying at the Hawthorne Best Western!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: vmlem
Reviews.Content: Superb accommodations! Excellent staff, rooms, location, service. Quaint and charming hotel in Wrigleyville with a short walk to Wrigley. We took in two Cubs games and walked each time. Very convenient. Son wanted players autographs so we walked to the players parking lot at 9:00 a.m. for the night game. Players are up close and personal. My son was pleased with gettng the autographs. Continental breakfast includes delicious cinnamon rolls from local bakery/cafe. Rooms are spacious and very clean and comfortable. Parking right next door with free in/out service is convenient as well. Try the Tuscany restaurant on Clark St. serving northern Italian cuisine at a reasonable price. We sat outside on the patio with a garden atmosphere. Service was a little slow but the entrees were impecable. We took a cab for as little as $4.00. Hotel will call the cab for you directly out the front door! I highly recommend this hotel if you are going to the Cubs games. It is a higher priced hotel but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable as a labrador”
Reviews.Author: Bunkerbuster
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorne Terrace is a Lakeview stalwart - always been there, the same crappy kitsch decor, but just the greatest place to stay in this part of Chicago. The staff are friendly, the rooms are nice (but the decor! please!) and the beds are comfortable. I have stayed here countless times on trips to Chicago and always return, so they must be getting something right. The location is what really makes this place stand out though, it's quiet, well located for all the bars, and you don't dread going back there in the evening. It's a basic place but ticks all the right boxes and better than every single one of the local alternatives. If you can't get into this place, from experience I would recommend Willows on West Surf which is also fine and a little furthe south just off N. Broadway. City Suites on Belmont is also fine but make sure you ask for a room away from the red line El which runs all night.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Best Western.. Ever”
Reviews.Author: Scarlet_Be
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel, we loved it. The hotel is probably the best hotel deal in Chicago. My husband and I booked this hotel for our very first time in Chicago. We chose it because of the proximity to our evening entertainment, but also partly based on the positive reviews on trip advisor. I was not let down. The hotel is in a great location close to restaurants, cafes and shops. Some of our favorites include the Goose Island brewery and the Chicago Diner both within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the surrounding area. The hotel itself was smaller than most hotels in the area and beautifully maintained. My only complaint about the hotel is that they do not have a computer for guest work, however given the proximity to many internet cafes it is not such a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: coneflowerPgh
Reviews.Content: We spent three days here while visiting my daughter who lives nearby. We were pleasantly surprised by how nice things were. We booked a junior suite, which was rather spacious and included a microwave and frig. The room was very clean and the bath seemed newly redone. There was no view and the hallway on the third floor had a weird odor but those were our only complaints. The breakfast bar had cereal, hard boiled eggs, jumbo muffins, fruit, toasting breads, juice ,tea and coffee. It was located in a small area and would get busy on occasion. We had breakfast one day at M Henry's in the Edgewater-Andersonville area. It is not to be missed. We parked in the lot next door which was convenient and discounted to the Hawthorne patrons. Wrigley Field is located just around the corner. On Saturday, we took a walk down the street, went to a cute petshop called Wigglyville and bought several items, also went to local farmer's market and puchased a few more things. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Also Doubled Billed”
Reviews.Author: dinadsmom
Reviews.Content: I too had problems with double billing at Best Western Hawthorne. I tried to resolve with the hotel and got nowhere, the asst manager and manager were no help at all. Spoke to Best Western Corporate and they even tried to resolve with the manager and got nowhere. Best Western corporate themselves refunded me the money and apologized profusely for the bad service. Problem is the hotel is independly owned. I will not stay again and advise other people the same. If you have a problem you are basically on your own. Too bad, because it is very convenient place for me to stay. Some staff members have a very "I don't Care" attitude. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: harks
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to visit a Niece and picked this area as it was only 7 blocks from her apartment. The hotel was clean, room was big and personnel very curtious. Continental breakfast was decent, not extravagant but filled us up for the morning. Plenty of restaurants and watering holes (bars) along Broadway. A short walk from Wrigley Field. Broadway Ave and Lakeview area were very clean, always sweeping sidewalks etc. Trains were just a few blocks away. Can easily catch a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Fabulous Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jennybody
Reviews.Content: I visit Chicago often and have stayed at numerous hotels, but our stay at the BWHT was fantastic. The hotel is cute, quant and in a great location. There are many fabulous resturants and shops near by (Equinox is one of my favorites). The staff was overly friendly and enthusastic, Michael suggested some fun things to do and see while we were there. All of his ideas were fresh and entertaining. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean and friendly place to stay. By the way, the commplimentary cinnamon rolls in the morning are a yummy way to start off your day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: greekprince
Reviews.Content: Great location...10 mins to the subway / EL trains...walking distance to Wrigley stadium & the gay scene. Staff....nice Complimentary breakfast.... basic...Starbucks is down the street. Rooms...clean, we were given a smoking room, when i had booked a non-smoking room online, but after a little complaining the cleaning staff did a good job cleaning the carpets and upholstery the next morning. Prices: good for what you get... you can pay twice as much in Chicago with not much more service to show for it. I would stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pillz
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay here when I visit Chicago, even though weekends have a two-night minimum. Walk 2 blocks down Roscoe to N. Halsted, which has some great gay clubs. Broadway between Roscoe and Belmont is very quaint, lots of small shops and restaurants. It's a nice walk. If you have a car it's a short drive to N. Michigan Ave and the museums. Parking at the garage next door is convenient, but remember to keep your ticket stub from the front desk, as you will need it to go in and out. The only suggestion is to avoid rooms next to the elevator, unless you want to hear dinging sounds all night. They couldn't turn it down, so the manager moved us to another room. Don't expect much of a view unless you're on the top floor. The breakfast is decent with your typical pastries, bagels, and cereal. If you're looking for things to do, there are brochures and local papers in the lobby. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MicMarta
Reviews.Content: Really quite disappointing. The staff seemed unavailable and distant. There was confusion about the rate I had booked online. The rooms were stale smelling, and not the cleanest. The free breakfast consisted of old muffins, some rolls, and bagels. I expressed my disdain to the manager at the end of our stay, and the impression I got was, "too bad." This hotel essentially runs itself, because of its extremely prime location. The staff doesn't need to put much effort into pleasing the guest, because it will always be solidly booked. You're better off to go off a few miles further south into the downtown area where there is a heavier hospitality competition, and each hotel WANTS to ensure that they get repeat business from you.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Preference Does Not Mean Non-Smoking”
Reviews.Author: SunnySpot
Reviews.Content: We made our reservastions on line with a non-smoking preference. We checked into the hotel and proceeded to our room. The room we were given was a smoking room. The maid was in the hall and offered to contact the front desk to get our room changed. We were informed that all the non-smoking rooms where taken and they would try to move us the next day. The next day we were informed that a non-smoking room was still not availabe. We saw another maid in the hall and requested she completely strip down the bed and sanitize our room. The maid did so which made our second night stay bearable. However, we did not stay our thrid night as intended. Just remember at this hotel a non-smoking preference does not get you a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: aznate27
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in this hotel for five days on a vacation to Chicago. We picked this hotel due to it's location to the water and the Lakeview area, also to it's close location to "boystown". For those of you unfamiliar with that, it's the gay area of Chicago. We booked a room with two queen beds which was very clean with a great bathroom. A light was burned out in the batroom when we first arrived, called down to the front desk to report it, had someone replace it within 15 min. The front desk staff was friendly and knowledgable about the area. We were within walking distance of restuarants, bars, clubs (mostly gay), grocerry stores, pretty much everything. And only a 15 min walk from the train which was a straight shot to all the great sites downtown. If your gay, this is a great hotel to stay at. If your straight, it's still a great place to stay and only minutes from Wrigley Feild and all the straight bars and pubs around there. All in all I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “DePaul Parent's best bet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor, we found the Hawthorne Terrace for our trip to student orientation at DePaul University in Lincoln Park. The hotel was fairly convenient (only a five minute drive from the Lincoln Park campus) and very comfortable. Parking at an independent parking garage was right next door, and was credited to our Best Western bill. Everything was clean, and the rooms were well appointed and slightly different from the standard layout of a hotel room. The lobby was a bit cramped, but there was an outdoor patio that looked inviting. This hotel is located in the heart of a very upscale district in Chicago, about 6 blocks or so from Lake Michigan. If you're gay, it's a great district to stay in. There are also plenty of attractive places to dine and drink. DePaul Parent's weekend is in October, and we plan on staying at the Hawthorne Terrace once again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Lakeview Area”
Reviews.Author: mcc44
Reviews.Content: We visit Chicago to see our son who lives in the Lincoln Park/Lakeview area. We've stayed in several hotels, including the so-called small "boutique" hotels on the near north side. We found this one to be more pleasant than any of those, and it was less expensive. The rooms appear to have been recently renovated and were a pleasant surprise, size-wise, for a city hotel. Everything was clean as a whistle. The beds were comfortable, although slightly squeaky. In our fourth floor room facing the city, it was quiet. The view was pleasant, although I think that rooms on lower floors probably look out on the walls of the drab building next door. The elevator was large and modern, the lobby was attractive, and there is an attractive small garden in front. The staff was pleasant, and when the charge was $1 more than I'd been quoted, the cashier offered to change it and wound up giving me a 25%discount coupon for our next visit. We will definitely use it, as this place was a good deal for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When in Chicago on business, I always stay at the Best Western Hawthorne Terrace. The staff is terrific: Warm, friendly, responsive. They love telling people about the history of the hotel and are thoroughly familiar with the area. The rooms I've stayed in have been fairly spacious, but the lighting could be improved in bedrooms, sitting areas (in rooms with them), as well as the bathrooms. Continental breakfast consists of the usual fare, but is more than adequate. I've never had a problem with noise when staying there; in fact, I have found it to be one of the more quiet hotels in which I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gregbkc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hawthorne Terrace several times although I have never written a review. My most recent visit was February 2006. Hawthorne Terrace is located in Lakeview, just a few minutes North of downtown Chicago. The hotel is within walking distance of shops, bars, nightclubs, resteraunts, and the Treasure Island grocery store is right next door. (great for stocking up on snacks) The hotel is emaculatly clean and the staff is friendly and helpfull. I've rarely ecountered such a friendly hotel staff. The rooms are cozy and the beds are amazingly comfortable. On each of my stays, I've always gotten a room with a window to the South. Unfortunately, this only allows for a view of the building next door. The hotel, although not really very close to the train line, is very close to the CTA bus system. Just a short 5 minute walk to Hawthorne and Lake Shore Drive will allow you to catch one of the express buses that will put you in the heart of downtown Chicago in minutes. I find this hotel sells out(on weekends) during the warmer months weeks ahead. I always advise to book early if you plan to stay here, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, I was blown away with everything. The staff was extremely helpful, they knew the Chiago CTA system well, they had multiple suggestions for activities, and they suggested great places to eat. The hotel room was very, very clean. I wasn't crazy for the decot though. The staff was very friendly and you could tell they enjoyed working there (very rare). Chicago is an AWESOME CITY and The Best Hawthonre Terrace Hotel THE PLACE TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Takemesomewhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Thanksgiving weekend after we couldn't get a reasonably priced hotel downtown. I'm very glad we did! The hotel was full, yet the hotel was more quiet than I would expect for a busy holiday weekend. The room was on the smallish side but I did see some larger rooms and I couldn't complain based on the deal we got for the room. The breakfasts were more than adequate (were those cinnamon rolls from the famous Ann Sather's restaurant across the street -they sure tasted like them?!). The best thing about this hotel is the location. If you want to see Chicagoans going about their daily business, then stay here! It was great to walk to restaurants, movie theaters, and shopping that Chicagoans actually frequent, not a bunch of stores and restaurant chains filled with tourists toting bags of souveniers like downtown. Yet you could walk out in front of the hotel and take a fifteen minute bus ride downtown. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-thin floors=nightime voices”
Reviews.Author: Spdmonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late August for a family get together nearby and while not cheap it was considerably cheaper and more convenient than the downtown hotels. The hotel itself is quite well kept and has a greeat deal of charm. I am not from a "big city" and must tell you that I did not feel uncomfortable in the neighborhood at night. There were many people out and about. I was in town the weekend of the Chicago Air and Water show and it was great to walk about a mile to the western end of the lakefront to see the air portion with flybys of all the combat jets! The hotel itself had mostly good points: Its quite clean-at least on the 2nd floor and our suite room with 2 double beds and a sofa bed was plenty of space for 2 adults and 2 children. They would be wise to add a second tv for the other side of the room though. The hotel is situated in the "boys town" area of Chicago so if you are not a fan of alternative lifestyles you may want to pass on this hotel. The ceiling/floors are pretty thin and at 2:00am you can hear any lovers quarel within a few rooms. Not the hotels fault for rude/unruly guests, but I was very offended by what I heard. Hotel management gave the standard theres nothing we could do although it went on for more than 30 minutes. Parking is impossible so prepare to hand your keys over to the garage next door although you can come and go with a ticket from the hotels front desk. Beds were very comfy and extra pillows were already in the room. Breakfast was standard fare and kids don't mind that! Would I go back? Yes because of location although I would ask for a room on the top floor and deal with the terribly slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Hotel! Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Buffetfan79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on August 29th through August 31, 2005. We were visiting Chicago as a little getaway for my birthday! We had tickets to a Cubs game and this hotel was perfect because it is only like 5 Blocks from Wrigleyfield. The hotel is in a great location if you want to experience Chicago without all of the hustle & bustle of being downtown. There were several little bars and restuarants all within walking distance and Lake Michigan was only about 2 blocks away! We actually spent alot of our time just walking around the neighborhoods and enjoying all of the views of the old homes & historic buildings. The hotel itself was so cute! It was very small and had a more of a bed and breakfast feel about it. I would reccomend this hotel to visitors young and old! It was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “If you love Ashtrays and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ebking22
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I stayed at in Chicago! If you are looking for a hotel to smoke in, this is your dream hotel. If you want a manager who is all about making your stay the worst possible experience Manager Stephen Hampton is your guy. Rather than write an essay about how terrible my experience was here just do your self a favor and stay at another place. If you want something in this neighborhood with great service, clean rooms and quaint charm I recommend the Majestic Hotel just up the street (528 West Brompton). Seriously do yourself and loved ones a favor and avoid this hotel!
